ResponseText: For someone seemingly hellbent on accusing atheists of not understanding any other points of view, it's pretty damn idiotic to threaten us with assertions that we know aren't true. QuoteText: For someone seemingly hellbent on accusing atheists of not understanding any other points of view, it's pretty damn idiotic to threaten us with assertions that we know aren't true.
ResponseText: What makes you think they're not true? Jesus arose from the dead. That's one of the most well attested to facts in ancient history, whether you want to casually sweep it under the rug or not. Many skeptics set out to prove the story of Christ to be a fairy tale. None succeeded and a number became believers. You guys are playing with absolute fire. If you're wrong (and you are), you're screwed big time. Big time and forever. Do you feel lucky? Well, do you?

I concur. I could embrace a McDonald's wrapper as revealing spiritual truth and make exactly the same argument: PROVE IT'S NOT! HA! Jesus, if he truly did exist, didn't rise from anything, and no one would even be claiming he DID if it weren't for PIE IN THE SKY.

QuoteText: Yeah, well you couldn't have made it to space without these guys: Scientists who believe in God Creation scientists and other biographies of interest And don't ever forget it. Your elitist arrogance in thinking people of faith are stupid is offensive and sophomoric.
ResponseText: Who cares if scientists believe in God? It means nothing what other people believe. You place too much emphasis on what people are telling you. I guess this makes sense considering you base your entire belief system only on what people have told you. That's all you have! Besides, are you saying that science is wrong or right? On one hand you refute science because it leads to a conclusion the Bible is wrong but then two seconds later you want to be on the side of scientists who believe in God. Somehow having people that aren't based in delusion who also believe in God makes you feel better? In response to your second point, I never said anything about being stupid. Just because I make your ideas look stupid doesn't mean I am saying you are stupid. All I said is that the Bible never helped anyone make progress in any way. Can you show me one tangible positive thing that has resulted from the Bible? (other than pretty churches of course)
